title: Anthony Blackwood
text:
Anthony Blackwood (born 13 September 1982) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played for the <a href="Crusaders%20Rugby%20League">Crusaders RL</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and the <a href="South%20Wales%20Ironmen">South Wales Scorpions</a> in <a href="RFL%20League%201">Championship 1</a>. He has previously represented <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> and played as a or .
Background.
Blackwood was born in <a href="Barrow-In-Furness">Barrow-In-Furness</a>, <a href="Cumbria">Cumbria</a>, England.
Playing career.
Formerly a back-row player, Blackwood signed for <a href="Crusaders%20Rugby%20League">Crusaders</a> in 2007 from <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a>. He is a former <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> academy captain.
International honours.
Blackwood made his Wales début against Scotland in 2005, winning caps for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> while at Halifax, and Celtic Crusaders 2005...present 7(6?)-caps 3-tries 12-points.
A regular and one of the most committed Welsh internationals, Anthony joined the Crusaders from Halifax at the start of last season following an impressive record with the Yorkshire-side. He continued to impress at the Crusaders in both the 2007 and 2008 season scoring 14 tries in year one followed by 11 in 2008
